Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Place!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaMom1993
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1-bedroom which was perfect for 2 people. More than 2 would be cramped. Room was very clean and smelled fresh. Bed was very comfortable. Up to date furnishings and fixtures. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Pool area was kept extremely clean. Only draw back to pool was that there were not enough tables/umbrellas and the area around the pool got cramped when there were a lot of people there. No wi-fi in rooms. Free use of washer/dryers. Overall, a great place to stay. Was told there are plans to upgrade/renovate rooms with new furniture, new sliding glass doors on balconies, and wi-fi for 2013. Look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place to Feel at Home.”
Reviews.Author: bobbyclovett
Reviews.Content: What can I say, always an Awesome Stay. Staff was even nice enough to Loan us a Gas Grille. So it was Surf and Turf all the way. Beware my only Problem is Leaving, the Daytona Life Style along with a Place that Feels like Home already. I always just want to stay 1 more day. Guess that's why I'm not allowed in KeyWest any more. LOL Enjoy, Have a Great Time. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with our Family”
Reviews.Author: OhioGrandma4
Reviews.Content: We could not have been treated any nicer if our own Family members were taking care of our needs. From the minute we walked in throughout the week, everyone from the people working at the front desk, the cleaning staff, maintenance staff and activities people. ANYTHING we needed they provided with a smile, and even offered to add additional activities when it was raining, to keep the children entertained. We had 3 two bedroom units with 10 adults and 7 small children in our group. The rooms are a little small (except for the master), but we figured for being on the beach we didn't need huge rooms because we spent most of our awake time outside. VERY cleanm units, and comfy beds too. The kids (big and little) enjoyed the hula hoop contest, water balloon contest, corn hole, slushes and ice cream (small extra fee for the slushes and ice cream ) by the pool. We missed many of the activities while swimming, but many more were available. The Dive in Movies was a hit with the kids and the Beach Party with DJ was GREAT time. Being that I am a late nighter, I can tell you it was very comforting to see security walking the property at all hours from the floors to the pool to the parking lot. No free Wi Fi in the rooms, but there is in a couple areas of the hotel. The ladies at the desk said when the hotel was last renovated it wasn't wired for Wi Fi but will be during upcoming renovations. I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels, and I would happily stay at this one again. :) Italian resteraunt across the street was pretty good, and Crabby Joes on the pier, and Aunt catfish's was REALLY good and not too far, but expect a wait to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dayton Seabreeze in June 2012 (week of tropical storm Debbie). First of all, the customer service is great! The staff did a really good job of moving activities inside and kept as many as possible on schedule.We had 5-6 people in each 2 bedroom/2 bath unit and had plenty of room. The pool area was excellent! We enjoyed the nighttime fire pit and the tiki torches. We grilled out several times. There is an Italian resturaunt just across the street that we felt was just 'ok', otherwise only a few places to eat within walking distance (Denny's and Red Lobster). Publix is 1/4 mile and Walgreens. We used the trolly to get to the boardwalk (4 miles). No free WiFi! Overall, it was good experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Week at the Seabreeze”
Reviews.Author: MustangJeanne2011
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Florida and truly enjoyed our stay at the Seabreeze. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The activities provided by the staff were excellent and it was fun to check the schedule posted in the lobby to see what we had in store for the day. The "Dive-In" movie was great...sit by the pool and watch a movie on a big screen. The rooms are OK. We had a one bedroom which is small, but did have a king size bed. The dalily laundry service for towels was really appreciated and unexpected. Many small touches make this resort a great place to stay. Would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: denrosesc
Reviews.Content: We loved this property, the rooms were small but adequate. The staff is wonderful, friendly, they make you feel like one of the family. We extended our stay by two days, they did back flips to make sure we had the same room, by moving other reservations so we could stay in the same room. The pool was great, so was the beach. We loved the torches at night and the fire pit. Having the Grills was fantastic, we cooked out a few nights. and spent time by the fire at night. One evening we had fish for dinner that we caught that day. We also went on the River Cruise from New Smyrna, Dolphin the buffet was good and the cruise was wonderful. Saw a manatee and lots of dolphins.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the The Sea Breeze form April 18th to the 21st. The staff there is great. They took care of all of us as my parents and my brother and his family where all on vacation. It rained one afternoon and the staff gave the kids towels because they saw how cold they where. All of them where very very nice people. The rooms where cozy and the porperty was nice and clean. We had rooms with and ocean view and balcony and it was just perfect. Also i left my watch in the room after we checked out and someone in housekeepinfg returned it to the front desk, and they called my sister in law and are going to ship the watch back to us. Thanks to however returned my watch that person is truly a very genuinely honest person. Thats how the Sea Breeze is though, a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property With Refreshing Flair”
Reviews.Author: Kdahlers
Reviews.Content: I spent the last week enjoying the Daytona Seabreeze with six friends. We had a great vacation and enjoyed the staff and amenities of the Bluegreen property and staff. The resort had everything we needed from ocean views to a prompt and family staff. The rooms are in good condition, but could use some minor refreshing. The outdoor space is great and the firepit is a great way to help you unwind after a great day in Daytona. We stayed in both a one bedroom and two bedroom for the first leg of our trip. Our 2 bedroom was on the 4th floor with great views, the walls must be thick as we did not have any noise disrupptions (nor did we cause any). The one bedroom on floor 2 did have a bit of a musty smell but this could be caused by humidity as well (the water pressure was great on the 2nd floor and OK on the 4th). The property has free laundry facilities located throughout and we were lucky enough to have one right next to our 4th floor room. The elevators were a little slow so we opted to use the steps whenever we could. Everything you neeed is fairly close restaurants, CVS/Walgreens, groceries at Publix. Daytona has a great bus and trolley system as well. Be sure to check out Crabby Joe's on the pier (less than 2 miles on the A1A) for breakfast surprisingly inexpensive and very tasty. One bedroom was a little small as we had 3 sharing, but it did the trick. We had six in the two bedroom and were fairly comfortable --- 3 bedrooms would have been better than 2 with six people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: waupun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Daytona Seabreeze in January of 2012. We and another couple had a two bedroom oceanfront unit that was a bit dated, but nice. We were told that a major renovation is going to start in April of this year. The only issue we had was our refrigerator. When we checked in, it was not cold at all inside. We were told that the cleaning staff needed to leave it open for a long time to thoroughly clean it. We bought groceries and put them in the refrigerator. Four hours later it still wasn't cold. We were told to be patient....that it would cool down. The next morning it had cooled down. Front desk staff and the people staying here ( we met quite a few ) were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: heather6jdl
Reviews.Content: Great location, and my kids loved the activities staff and all of their options. We had movie night with snacks, shakes at the pool, candy corn bingo, all free to us--these activities really engaged the kids and gave us a break :) A few downsides: one of the elevators was out of service the entire time, and the shower to rinse off from the beach wasn't working for a few days, and our rooms didn't actually connect, so we spent a lot of time knocking on each other's doors. Aside from that, we loved the easy access to the beach, the great views from the balcony, the ac systems that worked really well, and the beautiful pool!

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: 3wheelsmad
Reviews.Content: stayed there got eaten alive not in 1 room, but in the next 1 they moved us to as well demolish it only after burning it to the ground......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families, perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bush92
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Seabreeze and just got home today. The place is clean, the staff is super attentive, the ammenities are wonderful. Every day there were numerous activities, the pool is great, and of course Daytona Beach is pristine. We had a group of 10, with 4 small children and the loved every minute of it. It's close to shops, grocery, mini-golf, restaurants, etc. Couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Families!”
Reviews.Author: limyers
Reviews.Content: We took our children ages 16, 11 & 6 to the Seabreeze for a week of rest and relaxation. We were actually at the Seabreeze during Memorial weekend thru the first week of June 2010. Check-in was easy and quick and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The Activities Director, Starr, was also very friendly and helpful. What we really liked/appreciated: *clean, large, beautiful, private beach just a few steps away! *pool/beach toys & boogie boards available in a poolside box - awesome perk! *beautifully landscaped pool & grilling area - felt very tropical & fun *great kid/family activities *pleasant decor *very comfy king-size bed *pool & deck very clean; lots of chairs *separate kiddie pool * pool towels available (but they didn't tell us until the 4th day we had to let them know when we returned them into a dirty towel hamper. they actually mark it on your account that you returned them.) *free computers/internet access in the small library *located away from the "busyness" of Daytona Beach but only a couple minutes to drive to shopping/restaurants *family friendly atmosphere *close to Harbour Lights restaurant - fantastic & fun place to eat! *good selection of cable tv channels What we didn't like/appreciate: *master bedroom was largest room in the unit - everyone tended to congregate there *2nd bedroom extremely small *sleeper sofa extremely uncomfortable *only a 2-burner stove top & no oven (we have food allergy issues so it is best if can cook our own meals. difficult to cook for family of 5 w/2 burners. there was a convection oven/microwave combo which was a pain) *had a brief thunderstorm and ended up with 2" of water in the entryway and front bathroom. it came in under the front door. used all our bath & beach towels trying to keep it from soaking the carpet in the living area. husband ended up having to get a mop from maintenance to clean up. *bathrooms both small & only had pedastal sinks. no space to store anything except one small shelf above the sinks. *game room was not worth going into (which can be good or not, depending on whether you like to spend money on that kind of thing.) *laundry room located on only 2 floors. luckily, we were on a floor that had a laundry room. Overall, this is a great resort for families who want a low-key vacation where you can relax and enjoy spending quality time together in a comfortable atmosphere. It is not an upscale, posh resort with spa svcs., on-site restaurants, etc. We would recommend it to others and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved Loved Daytona Seabreeze!!!”
Reviews.Author: klh0376
Reviews.Content: This was the best vacation I have had in a while!! The check in process was smooth and quick. They told me about the resort, amenities and local attractions that all came in handy. I had to book my vacation in 2 different reservations and they were so accomodating in helping my room be a stayover instead of moving rooms midstay. The lobby was beautiful and spotless!! As soon we entered the lobby I knew this was going to be a wonderful vacation. I was greeted by a friendly sales staff that was not pressuring at all to tour. If i had more time, would have loved to hear the presentation however I dont get that much time from work and was going to take advantage of every minute of this stay. However, they did greet me with refreshing lemon water. (plus while speaking to them, all I could see was the beach in the view behind them that was calling my name!) Our room was close by the elevators which i loved the easy access to. Upon entering the room, It smelled fresh and clean and felt light and airy with the sun shining in from the 2 balconies! I really liked the new decor. The room was spacious and slept 6 comfortably!! The king bed in the master bedroom was sooo comfortable!! I slept like a baby! The curtains blew up from the AC but I solved this by placing towels on the ledge so i could sleep in without the sun shining in. Although, a few mornings, I slept with the curtains open to see the sunrise from bed!!! AWWWWW perfection!! We spent most of our time at the beach in front of the hotel and met a wonderful business owner named Tom from Greg's Beach rentals (email me and I will give you his info if you want it) They provided umbrellas, chairs and even a tent if you wanted it!!! We used them every day and it was all set up by 9am each morning!!! The pool was great too!! We loved the entertainment!! that was the best and the activities team did a great job!! So much enthusiasm!! My only sadness was missing the dive in movie that is my favorite at Bluegreen properties but I had to leave so that was my fault! I did enjoy the smores at the bonfire !! YUM YUM and ice cream socials in the afternoon were a perfect way to cool off. This was a a wonderful vacation and would highly recommend it for families, singles, couples, friends and even business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - would go again!”
Reviews.Author: HaleyLyons
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Seabreeze was wonderful! We had a two bed two bath oceanfront condo and it was nicely decorated and really clean. The front desk was super helpful, especially Starr! They had a nice activity room and game room for the kids and the grounds were kept up wonderfully. Anytime we passed any staff members they always said hello and had a smile. We were there during bike week were really pleased with the accommodations for bike parking. They even provided wash buckets for our bike. I only wish they had internet in the rooms. For $10/day we could have internet, but if it was as slow as what was the library it would not have been worth it. That was very minor compared to the wonderful stay, though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburghblondie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and decor was modern. Had plenty of space... great little kitchen... everything was great! If i could buy it as an apartment, I would!!! Will stay there again if I go back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Average - Location Great”
Reviews.Author: summatimegirl
Reviews.Content: Daytona Seabreeze is an older building which appeared to be a hotel originally and then later was converted to timeshares. It has been updated somewhat but I would have to say the interior of the units are just average. Nothing special. We had a two bedrm unit with two baths. The master bedrm is very large and the secondary bedroom is very small. The living rm had a sofa sleeper. Our son slept there and didn't complain so I guess it was fine. The other beds were comfortable but the problem for me was that the unit was easy to cool down but the humidity never left the room. The rooms have the a/c units like a hotel (under the window.) They do not remove the humidity very well. The kitchen is a full kitchen with a two burner cooktop but very small. My major complaint is that the bathrooms have pedestal sinks with only a small shelf above the sink to sit items. Both bathrooms in the unit were exactly the same. Not much room for all your bathroom stuff. It was just a nuisance. The only other thing that bothered me was that the living room was interior meaning no windows. It was nice to be beach-front but the windows and balconies were both located in the bedrooms. Kinda felt like a dungeon when you were sitting in the living room. Not that we stayed in the unit much but when you were in there, you didn't get that "being at the beach" feeling. The location in Daytona Shores was the best part. There are many places to eat and shop if you go North. The Ponce DeLeon Lighthouse was very nice to visit as well. Be prepared to climb many stairs and if you don't like heights, don't tackle it! I've posted a few pics. As far as the value, we traded thru RCI to stay here. I was amazed to see that they have it listed as a Gold Crown resort. Overall, not a bad place but just average in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: cdc101379
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on our way back to NC from South Florida using our Bluegreen Bonus time. We had a one bedroom unit. These units are very nice and clean, and are very stylishly decorated. The one negative is that they are relatively small. I do not recommend a 1BR for a family of more than 3. All the units are ocean front and have a small balcony overlooking the ocean. There are alot of activities for children and it seemed like a great place for children and teens. The pool area is very nice as is the fire pit with big chairs around it. I highly recommend this resort for anyone looking for a great beach getaway. If you get a chance to go out to eat make sure to go to Aunt Catfish's just down the road-you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: blu_grassgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay for us. I did have a few minor complaints: The pool staff needs to be more on the ball, several times we saw the trash cans poolside overflowing and the bottom of the pool had alot of sand . With all other Bluegreen properties we have been at, early morning you will find staff hosing down the pool deck and aligning chairs etc, we never saw that...only 1 gentlemen testing the water through-out the day. There was quite a bit of small debris in the water that was never skimmed out that we saw. The housekeeping staff is great except they kept bringing us hand towels instead of wash clothes. I do wish the gift shop was larger such as the one at Casa Del Mar in Ormond. The Dive-In movie was awesome! 2 amazing things happened on our stay. The first was we were not pushed to do an owner update..you Bluegreen owners know what I mean! LOL They just kind of blew us off about it, guess the recession is hitting them and they are saving those update gifts! The second was WONDERFUL!~ We checked out on Thursday and went to a hotel further down the beach. Friday night my daughter realized she couldn't find the charger to her handheld video game~~ let the thunder and hail reign down on us all at this point!! Saturday morning early I called Seabreeze and asked if it had been found, they said no but as soon as the present guests checked out they would go in and do a search. By 8:30am they called me back and said it had been found under the couch and what address would I like it shipped to!! I told them we are still in town and would be right there. We sooo appreciate the extra effort on their part!!! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bettyj88
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 2 time very happy with the room and the staff, if could change anything , would be we wanted to sit out by the pool and unwind after the race , but it was closed but i will stay there again, like everything about this hotel. great place for a family to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great week at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OKGranny
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were unable to book our usual fall week in S. Fl and decided to come here. The rooms were attractive, clean, and best of all, face the surf just yards away. The staff was accomodating and pleasant. The beach is the cleanest beach I have been on in years. WE found some great mom/pop local eateries and also some more upscale establishments. It is nicely located to many other FL attractions, Orlando, St Augustine, Cape Canaveral etc. Even in Nov we had a few days we lazed by the pool. The common outdoor areas were pretty and many people seemed to enjoy the grills. Walgreens, Publix are just down the road. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Families”
Reviews.Author: jenntyl99
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here (13 year old, 11 year old, and 4 year old children) for a week in July. This resort is in an excellent location and is away from the busier part of Daytona. This is a bonus for the resort because the hub of Daytona seems more crazy for families with children. The Seabreeze is located on the south end of Daytona shores and is close enough to Ponce Inlet and other major roads, as well as some quick drives to many restaurants. The beach outside the resort is often uncrowded and it is obvious this is a family friendly part fo Daytona. The resort itself is great for its location and the resort staff are very friendly. When you walk in the lobby you will notice several sitting areas and the activities desk, front desk, and manager's desk. In addition, the game room, library with internet access and activities room are all on the first floor. The pool is also a short walk around the corner and teh front desk will provide towels if you ask. The nice thing about this pool is it was never too crowded to enjoy and the resort allows the use of pool toys (they also have a tub full of pool flotation toys and boogie boards they allow you to use). Adjacent to the pool is the tiki area, equipped with grills, several areas to sit and eat, and the fire pit. This is all lit at night and at any time you can request the grills to be turned on for your use. The rooms are very nice, however, one must not be too quick to compare them to the Fountains in Orlando. Each Bluegreen resort offers something different and the Daytona Seabreeze's selling point is the beach. That being said, the rooms are spacious enough and are equipped with a full kitchen. This is an added bonus for saving money, as eating out every night gets expensive. One word of caution though, if you are going to purchase groceries for your stay avoid Publix (unless you like spending alot of money). Winn Dixie is not as pricy and is only a few minute drive past Publix. Anyway, the rooms in this resort are either one or two bedroom. We had the one bedroom and even with the 5 of us we never felt cramped. The bedroom has a king sized bed and its own tv and a balcony. The living area has a pull out sofa with a tv and a smaller sofa to the side that could easily sleep a small child. The kitchen is small and sits 4 but if you are like our family, we did most of our eating on the balcony enjoying the beach. Also, all rooms are oceanview. Overall, this resort made for a great family destination for us. Previously we had negative feelings about Daytona because of being in the busier section but our stay here changed that. We loved the location, the friendliness of staff, the resort feel, and above all the beach. The only negative we could find is that the pool and tiki area closes at 10pm. On weekends it would have been nicer to have this open later.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TwinMominSC
Reviews.Content: Booked on a Thursday afternoon to arrive on Friday for two-night stay. Really cute and clean one-bedroom condo had pull-out couch for our kids. Dividing wall in suite convenient for putting them to sleep. TVs in both rooms; DVD player and stereo. Fully equipped kitchen in room is great addition and convenient if you plan to stay several days (nice grocery only a few blocks away). Suggest groceries to pack lunch if you want to eat on the beach or for quick trip to room for food - no food options really on beach outside hotel other than passing ice cream trucks. Beach was nice, clean, not at all crowded. Take advantage of umbrella rental on beach to keep cooler and extend time in sun ($25/day for umbrella, 2 chairs, table). Fun kid activities available as is game room for tweens/teens. Pool was great for young ones still learning to swim - 3 feet deep in shallow end. Very pretty too, with tiki torches lit up at night. Also a grill area. Only yuck factor was having to go to the 'time-share salesperson' to get your free parking pass so they can try to schedule a sales pitch appt. FYI: They do a towel exchange daily, but charge for daily maid service.

Reviews.Title: “NOt if you liek quality”
Reviews.Author: taylorsgh1
Reviews.Content: I found the Seabreeze at best a 5 on a scale of 10. Just to be fair I am a 4 star person. Quality means a lot. Just so happen we had a lot of rain that week. they have leaky roofs in the lobby. they had elavators not working, acess doors to the pool and beach were closed off 1 day. We had to walf around the building to gain access. Not the picturesque resort you would imagine. Elegance and confrot does not describe this resort. Lundry rom wer so nasty, we brought our clothes back home to wash. Iif mediocore is your thing, than the Seabreeze is your resort.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Bahama House My Experience”
Reviews.Author: aparnakollace
Reviews.Content: "Daytona Bahama House” hotel is located at the right side of the beautiful daytona beach in Florida. There are so many beautiful places are there near by this hotel. They are Kennedy Space Center, Disney World and cocoa beach. There are so many people visiting this place in vacations. The interior decoration of the hotel was nice. Especially for visitor hotel management offering special discounted rates for upcoming events in Daytona Beach. All age’s people can enjoy alot. So, why late visit [-]

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mlwhite05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of my timeshare, which is the reason we chose it. Was very nice, I think all rooms are oceanfront condos, some with the balcony off the bedroom, some with the balcony off the living room section. Had a king size bed, pull out sofa/wrap around couch, kitchen area with everything, large bathroom (well, larger than mine at home), 2 tv's, stereo, and dvd player. Had direct access to the beach from the pool area, wasn't loud at all. The decor was also very nice, very modern, although the outside of the hotel looked like it could use some work. Had a nice pool area, and grilling area/fire pit right adjacent to the pool. We grilled out our last night there and sat around the fire listening to the ocean, very nice. The lighthouse and speedway were about 6 miles away from the hotel. Quite a few restaurants nearby, not alot of bars though if that is what you are looking for-you have to go downtown, which is still only 5 miles. If you have never been to Daytona, be careful when driving. Along with many others (drove through a speed trap), we were pulled over for going 45 in a 35mph zone down Atlantic Ave. and given a $181 ticket. Other than that, hotel was great, location was great. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lisk
Reviews.Content: I took a short vacation with my daughter, her friend, my mother and her boyfriend. I did not expect it to be Bik-tobter week, but the resort was very quiet. I read some of the reviews on the resort before confirming the trip. As I arrived the help at the front desk was very pleasant and the resort had a fresh clean smell in the front lobby, even though I arrived at close to 8:00 p.m. The room was very clean and roomy. The next morning I was able to meet Star the coordinator. Star was great, she was beyond helpful. In the mornings, my mother and I get up early and we would not want to wake up the rest of the crew so we would sit in the lobby and have some fresh brewed coffee. Meanwhile, all the workers would pass by and greet us with a heart felt good morning and when Star arrived, forget it, we would talk about everything. Star was very informative on events and activities of the resort and the town. I must say the whole staff was great. I cant wait to return and see everyone. I even got a big good-bye hug from Star as I checked out. It was truly a nice relaxing vacation. Thanks to the great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place, HATED the event coordinator”
Reviews.Author: ml83
Reviews.Content: Loved the place, it has changed a lot since the last time we visited 3 years ago. Excellent rooms, lovely patio and pool deck with 3 grills and picnic tables. IF you are not familiar with the area, do not ask the event coordinator for any information. Very uninformative and decieving person. She sent us on this boat tour that has a dinner served and there is gambling available. We were suspicios and stated very clearly that 1) one person suffers from motion sickness and b) we HATE gambling and do not gamble ever. To both of those she replied, the boat is so huge, you won't even feel like you're on water and that there are so many things to do on the boat that you don't have to gamble. Talk about a night ruined. The shuttle bus was an hour late. On the ride there, we picked up a homeless man who decided to cleanse himself on the bus. When we got to the destination, it was not a huge boat, average sized casino boat. We walked in and sure enough, it was a plain casino boat. By the time we realized that there is nothing but smoking and gamblig, the boat took off and we were stranded there for the next 6 hours. We were so sea sick by the time we docked again that no words can describe it. The food was terrible - cheapest buffet style ever. On the ride back to the hotel, the bus driver fell asleep and the bus started going off the road, talk about a near death experience. By the time we got back, it was 4am and we had to check out by 10. Needless to say I was outraged at that person and let them have my piece of mind. Doubt that anything was ever done about the bus driver or the coordinator.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY BETTER”
Reviews.Author: windy38506
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SEABREEZE this summer from 6-028 TO 07-04 of this year 2008. We had stayed at this location before in October of 2006. Upon returning, there had been changes to the hotel,only for the better. The front desk was so nice,they offer pool towels all day,they have a daily paper available each day for .75 cents, offered coffee with real creamer/flavored in the lobby. Throughout the week they had activities for the small and older to attend. They have updated their pool chairs and have three gas grills, several wood chairs around a gas fire pit , really nice for teenagers. At front desk you can buy a baggie with marshmallows and graham crackers for a dollar for smores. We also recieved clean towels each day,not having to wash them was a plus. The concierge, her name being Star was very informative. I think our family trip was a hit, great place to stay, shopping for groceries close by too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: woodsy528
Reviews.Content: I was glad we were able to get a room at the Seabreeze for the days that we needed to watch my daughter compete at the cheerleading nationals. I was also glad to be south of town, since Daytona was extremely busy during the competition. We were able to enjoy the crowds when we felt like it, then go back to the Seabreeze for some quiet time. I was disappointed though, that the pool closed at 10:00. We never got to enjoy the hot tub in the evening because it was always close to, or after 10:00pm, when we got back. I always forget when we go to Florida, that you must buy your liquor at a liquor store, and that most of them close fairly early. Being from Michigan, we are used to running into CVS and being able to buy all of the beverages we like to have on hand (milk, pop, juice and liquor) It would be very nice if the resort rented or had even those cheap $12-$16 folding loungers to take out on the beach. The Maverick in Ormond Beach had them and it was sooo nice to be able to use them and not pay a fortune. I believe all condo's should supply certain things like salt & pepper, & more than one days worth of sugar & creamer. The one bedroom condo we stayed in had one of the largest balconies at the resort and a very nice view. It was a long and narrow unit and I think it would have been very tight for more than two adults. It was perfect for the two of us. The bed was super comfortable!!!! The pillows were great too! The water pressure was excellent. Lots of hot water! And everything was clean! The "library" where the computers were was very nice, too. We just put our dirty towels outside the door in the laundry basket and new ones were supplied. We only had to do this once, as there were plenty of towels for just the two of us. I loved the grassy area with the fire pit and barbeques. I wish all resorts would play light caribbean style music by the pool - since most don't want you to play your own music on the radio. It would be nice if there was food and drinks at the resort but you can always have your own little picnic after going to the nearby Publix. Take the drive to Lighthouse Point and have lunch by the water at the Inlet Harbor Restaurant. We love this place! We also stopped by the Marine Science Center and learned a few things about turtles. The Inlet Harbor Restaurant is fun togo to in the evening too -live music and dancing, good food & drinks-enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Seabreeze”
Reviews.Author: JimmytheP
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Seabreeze and found a very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms were clean and in good shape. We had another couple come with us and we had two kids as well. The two bedroom, two bathroom units were a bit cramped for six but we made it work. I liked the location of the Seabreeze. It was far enough from Daytona Beach to avoid the large crowds of "Spring Break", but easy to get anywhere in Daytona to enjoy the attractions. I was a little puzzled why RCI rated this property as a 'gold crown resort' and one of the other properties that Bluegreen owns the Shorecrest Villas in North Myrtle Beach that is just as nice is only rated as a 'silver crown'. The pool was a nice size and heated which is a plus when the weather was in the mid 70's in early March. The pool lost the sun around 5:00 pm when it started to drop on the west side of the resort and the area cleared out shortly after but then picked up in the evening again. I'm sure that it stays sunny longer later in the year but it does cool the pool area off fairly fast in the early spring. All in all we had a very enjoyable time and wouldn't hesitate to go again. There is plenty to do and see in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: crb01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Seabreeze last week. We had a nice room on the corner of the building, overlooking the pool area. We found our room to be very clean and comfortable. One bedroom had a huge closet for storing our bags etc., the other bedroom was slightly small but was nice. The staff was alway nice and friendly. Everything we needed was available to us such as beach towels, bath towels, laundry soap, dishsoap etc. On Wednesday there was live music by the pool complete with fruit and meat and cheese trays. We booked our reservation through BlueGreen and everything went very smoothly with no problems at all. The only negative was when we checked in there was a pretty hard push to do an owner update, an offer of money, than an offer of $20 more dollars to do it. Three times we said no, we were not interested before we had to sternly say no. Then focus was switched to other members of our party as to if they would be a referal, another push to just listen to the presentation for an hour. We finally just told the lady that we didn't qualify as we didn't make enough money. It was too pushy, and when you have just arrived after a long drive and want to check out your room you have to go through this sales push. However, we were never approched again through our entire stay which was appreciated. The pool area was always nice and clean, as was all other facilites within the property. I would stay again without hesitation. The rooms and lobby are nicley decorated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation Spot, Vistor from Va.”
Reviews.Author: cfamilyvirginia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at seabreeze in a one bedroom unit. The room had a great view. However, the unit was a little small, next time will book a two bedroom. Resort had live entertainment by the pool which was very nice. Overall a good stay from a good price.

Reviews.Title: “New and Nice!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChic05
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at the Daytona Seabreeze Resort in March of '06. The place is newly remodeled; we stayed in a room that no one else had ever stayed in before! The beds are comfortable, kitchen is fully equipt with everything from dishes to blenders and toasters. The only thing that could use a bit of help was the front desk service. Sometime we had to wait an hour or more after we called and asked for towels, but right down the hall from our room was a laundry closet--and we sometimes just snuck in that unlocked room :) The resort is right on the beach, just walk out the back and the steps lead you right down to the coast. There is a firepit, grills, a pool and hottub outside. You can't drink out of glass bottles at the resort outside or on the beach. The pool and hottub closed at 10 while we were there and the security walks around a lot on the resort to enforce this and the beach patrol on the beach enforce it there, too. The view from the rooms is amazing; just try not to let the birds bother you while they squak in the morning. We acutally got a noise complaint. I am 19, and I stayed with my boyfriend and his family--we are all age 19 and above. We were playing cards with light music on at 9:30 and were told to be quiet--TWICE. It was a little ridiculous, but we later found out an elder woman was alone next door to us. There is plenty of stuff to do on the beach: rent a 4-wheeler, parasail, deep sea fishing... You won't be bored! The resort gets pretty quiet at night, but there are some great restaurants in town, just ask the front desk to recommend one. There is also a souvenir shop literally right across the street. The resort is lit up at night with lights and looks very pretty! If you are looking for a quieter resort and just want to relax--this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Daytona Seabreeze”
Reviews.Author: vpw
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Daytona, and we enjoyed the experience thoroughly with the help of the staff at the Seabreeze. The staff was helpful from the time we checked in until the time we left. The rooms were great. Everthing was clean and neat. Resort offered many activities. Starr gave us great information on restaurants and things to do around the area. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: setu01
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay at Daytona SeaBreez resort by Blue Green. It is really nice kept place. Rooms are huge and furniture is very nice. It had best ocean view and very clean. Housekeeping and room service is awesome. Reception staff is very helpful. -Setu

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations, Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: dee81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Daytona Seabreeze and really enjoyed our experience there. The biggest plus was the extremely nice front desk staff. They were there to help with anything and were always offering to be of assistance in any way. The hotel itself is nice. It has been remodeled in a pretty modern style and had a great view of the beach. All rooms are oceanfront, so you don't have to worry about looking out your window at the street or something. If you just want to go hang out on the beach everyday, this is a great spot. The picutres shown on the hotel's website may be a tad misleading, simply because they make the hotel look brand spanking new, while in fact, you can kind of tell it is an older hotel that has been remolded. But saying that, it was a great hotel and a great experience, and we would stay there again if we ever went back to Daytona. Daytona itself is pretty run down and I think that was the biggest negative part of our trip. There must have been more old, empty, run down buildings lining the streets than buildings currently in use. A lot of construction is also going on, which was also somewhat unpleasant to look at everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, we'd like to stay again sometime.”
Reviews.Author: dreamermommy
Reviews.Content: Our party included my mother, my husband and myself, and our three children ages 4, 2, and 1 year old. We stayed in a 2-bedroom, 2-bath unit for one week, and enjoyed our stay very much. We found the Sea Breeze to be very well-managed with friendly, helpful, professional staff. I didn't see any mold or rust anywhere, although there were some water stains (?) on one bathroom door. When Bluegreen bought the Surfside Inn a few years ago, they gutted the interior and rebuilt it with larger suites. Hurricanes in '04 stole some of the beach, and the Army Corp of Engineers was scheduled to come and replace some sand from offshore - but Katrina changed those plans. However, in the past two years, 20 feet have already been naturally replaced. We thought the beach was quite wide, with a nice very gentle slope. During our stay, we compared beaches to our north and south. To the south (New Smyrna), the sand was grittier and there was much more traffic, people. To the north (Daytona), the sand might have been softer but there was more trash and people. Our sand was "perfect" and clean, and there were never very many people. We had a lifeguard right behind us, from 10 to 6. My only complaint about our beach was that several non-stinging jellyfish-things washed up just before we arrived (looked like clear silicone breast implants!), and one morning there were several sandcrab-things and little fish coming in with the shallow waves - ugh! At least nothing stung/pinched, and our kids enjoyed catching/releasing the sandcrab-things. The day before we arrived, a man had to be rescued from a rip-tide, so be careful!! We were told most dangerous rip-tides occur in the spring (?). It was nice having the grassy lawn, and the shaded pool in the afternoons. The resort provided several toys and floats for everyone to use, along with towels. The swimming pool was warm, and the hot tub was HOT. In the evenings, the fire pit and torches were lit, and music was always playing. Across the street, there was a Drive-In Christian Church (interesting!) and a great beach/souvenir shop where we purchased umbrellas at a good price. A Wal-Mart Super Center and a Super Target weren't too far away. The resort offered several daily activities like crafts/bubbles for children, pampering sessions for women, sand-castle contests or root beer floats, breakfast buffet for families. It is in the process of adding a library, and (I think) an exercise room. There was a small room with a few arcade games and an air-hockey table, and there were "secret" decks on the second and third floors. Due to water conservation laws, each suite did not have its own washer/dryer for clothes, but there were free laundry rooms on each floor. I never saw a bug or mosquito! Our suite was roomy enough, but there didn't seem to be enough storage space for things like our groceries in the kitchen, toiletries in the bathrooms, and our sandals/towels/cooler in the entry-way. Water-pressure was okay, not great but not terrible. Our master bed was very firm, and the bottom sheet/pad kept persistently slid off the top corners (grr). The balcony railings were safely-spaced about four inches apart, and very secure. However, the dining table/chairs were not good for small children, because they have no backs (we moved our set to seat the children against one wall). The resort didn't have high chairs - but they did bring us a crib, for the baby to sleep in. We had 3 TVs and 1-2 stereo systems. Each bedroom had its own air-condition unit under the window, and a regular door out to its own balcony. The master bedroom was the size of the second bedroom and living room combined. We never heard any neighbors - good walls! Our kitchen had a large set of pans, dishes, glasses, electric can opener, blender, etc. The microwave doubled as an oven, for real baking. The bathrooms had hair dryers, and we had an iron, ironing board, vacuum cleaner, etc. There was a trash chute at the end of our outdoor hallway, and whenever we needed new bath/kitchen towels, we set our hamper of dirty ones just outside our door. There were two elevators, centrally located, but they weren't very speedy. The front desk had some board games and movies to check out, and there was a little area/table in the lobby for children to color with crayons. We have been Bluegreen owners for six years, and have never regretted joining. Resorts like this have really spoiled us. On our way home, we stopped along the Gulf Shore at some timeshare places which are partly owned by Bluegreen, but the beach there wasn't nearly as nice as Florida's, and the staff/facilities weren't even half as nice as the Sea Breeze. Yay, Bluegreen, Good Job here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a big family”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_ATL
Reviews.Content: We had a total of 8 people stayed in 2 bedroom suites for 5 days. There was plenty of space. The kitchen is small but adequate. Also, there is a BBQ place (3 grills) downstairs. The building maybe a bit old (that should explain the water stains on the doors of master bedroom). But the rooms are clean and nice. Water pressure in the shower is great. The decor is exactly like what's in the photos. The beach is beautiful and service is excellent. A little over an hour to drive to the Disney World and about 45 minutes to St. Augstine's Outlet mall. Publix is right cross the street is you need groceries. Every morning we open the curtain and the ocean view is one of the best I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suz78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Daytona Seabreeze from July 8th thru the 14th. We found the two bedroom suites to be great. They were nicely decorated and the master bedrooms were HUGE! They are very quiet as I never heard any TV noise or conversation from another room! The staff was more than helpful and accomodating. The rooms were very clean and we had everything that we could of wanted or needed. The pool was one of the largest and nicest that I have ever seen. They have a "common" area with gas grills, patio tables and a fire pit for late night conversation. I would definitely recommend staying at the Daytona Seabreeze!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No problems at Daytona Seabreeze”
Reviews.Author: itisjustus
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Daytona Seabreeze between Christmas & New Years because it was the only Bluegreen Vacation Club offering where we could get two rooms in the geographic area & time frame that we needed. We met my in-laws there for two days. Both rooms were in really good shape. The kitchenettes were well appointed (but note that they are kitchenettes, not full-sized kitchens). The artwork wasn't to my taste, but hey... Everything was clean (with only a tiny bit of mold on the bottom of one shower curtain). The staff were to a person very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “change isn't always good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the daytona surfside many times before. Now that it is the daytona seabreeze, it is disappointing. First of all, our check in was a disaster....I booked our reservation through "bluegreen" and told them we required a 2 bedroom suite to sleep 6. When we arrived, with a very tight time schedule, they told us the room we were booked was only a one bedroom. They then told us we booked with an outside agent and we needed to call to straighten it out and try to get a 2 bedroom. The company we called were of no help. the front desk then told us it would be a while for her to try to get us what we needed. She told us to go get lunch while they fixed it! How long does it take to see what rooms are open and get us into one? We got a 2 bedroom suite finally, 1 hour later. The room are nice but the decor is not my first choice. Oh by the way, it is now a timeshare and housekeeping is at a minimum and a price. They no longer have a restaurant or a lounge. The kitchens in the rooms are adequate. They made the 2 bedroom suites with one less bed though, so kids are on the pull out couch. Anyway, the company may have thought they were updating but they took away from the original charm. It is doubtful that we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Biketoberfest 2005”
Reviews.Author: jacobscc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seabreeze for 2 nights during Biketoberfest 2005. We were very pleased with the accomodations, especially since we got such a good rate through Orbitz...$74/night. The unit was on the second floor and ocean front. The whole unit was new and clean. We didn't know that it had been completely refurbished and re-opened July 2005 until we checked in. Great place! The view from the balcony is very nice and it is also private since it has concrete walls between you and the next unit. The only thing that could have been improved on was the water pressure in the shower. We will gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Renovated ~ Daytona Beach Shores Gem”
Reviews.Author: cymo
Reviews.Content: Vacationing in Florida to see Family, my 2 Sisters, Cousin and I decided to get away to the Beach for the weekend. We chose Daytona Seabreeze and could not have had a more wonderful and satisfying stay. Not only were the accomodations fantastic, but the ocean view and beach were superb. We arrived Saturday at about 11 AM and although checkin was not until 4 PM a room was available and we checked in immediately. This used to be the Surfside Inn and it was purchased by BlueGreen Corporation for vacation club rentals. We booked this room through a 2nd party internet site and received a fantastic rate of $104 per night for a King size Suite. The room far exceeded what we expected. Decorated in the 50's-60's motiff, it had 1 King sized bedroom with a full bath, 1 Queen size bedroom, a second full bath, a living room with an L-shaped sleeper sofa, a full kitchen with all amenities and both bedrooms had balconies which overlooked the pool area and ocean. The view was well worth every penny! Starr- the concierge, was so very helpful answering any questions and suggesting dining options. The first night we were there, Starr arranged for us to be picked up and shuttled, free of charge, to "Views" Tavern and Grill. This is located on Seabreeze Blvd. in Daytona Beach. The food was excellent- 3 of us chose the special which was baked flounder with sauce and diced tomatoes and came with mouth watering vegetables and carribean potatoes. The other meal chosen was Shrimp Teriyaki and it also was very delicious. The atmosphere was great and the Sangria with real fruit really hit the spot. The 2nd day we dined at a small riverside eatery and had Grouper- you cannot visit Florida without having this. Starr also recommended this place and we liked it because it was casual and quick before we were picked up by the free shuttle to go on the SunCruz Casino Boat. It was a great time, although I came back with a lighter purse. The beach was fantastic! If you want to visit Daytona Beach and want to avoid the crowds, August is the time to go. We would walk out of the elevator, pass the desk, walk by the pool and down the stairs to the beach. We rented beach chairs and umbrellas both days of our stay for a nominal fee- but would not go any other way. Watching the sunrise from the beach or our balcony was a sight to see. The beauty of the ocean is something that everyone should see at least once in their lifetime. We even got to see dolphins swimming within 50 ft of the beach. It was a memorable weekend- awesome accomodations, friendly and courteous staff and beauty all around. Thanks to all at the Daytona Seabreeze for making it happen!

Reviews.Title: “5 days at Daytona Surfside”
Reviews.Author: Ishmayel
Reviews.Content: My son and I had to stay in Daytona Beach from 7/29-8/3/04 on family business. I chose this place because of oceanfront location, internet access, available kitchen, and exercise room. It was fine, no problems. Our room was on the top floor. Everything was neat, clean, and in working order. The staff were all friendly and helpful, except the night clerk who slept through our 3:30 AM wakeup call. Thank goodness for the alarm clock that worked! And except for a little rust stain on the refrigerator, I have no criticism of the room or facilities. It is not a luxury property, but for an oceanfront location, it is a bargain. The "beach" at Daytona Beach, is remarkable for its width, flatness, hardness and cars, often occupied by smokers and drinkers who pitch their butts and cans out the window. Not my idea of a "beach" in any sense, except for the fascinating shorebirds and pelicans. If you need to stay in this area, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WashTravelerPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 2 nights, July 16th & 17th. Had a room on the top floor. Nice clean room. Really nice view. Saw they were redoing the outside of the hotel. Had no problems with anything. I do think the hotel needs to add another elevator - the wait was a little long sometimes! Thought everything was clean and up to standard. Would stay here again. Stayed here twenty years ago and decided to try them again and was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Daytona Surfside to be clean and convenient. No maintenance problems where we stayed on the 2nd floor, and parking was easily available. Staff was very accomodating and friendly. Pool was lovely and immaculate, and area around pool was well maintained. Our room was very clean and comfortable for a 3 nights stay with two teenagers. We ate only one meal in dining room and don't recommend it, but there is other food nearby, and a large grocery store just down the road. Beach was lovely, with minimal cars, and rentals available close by. We've traveled world-wide and found this to be within the average range, and quite acceptable for a family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Crumbling structure, health & safety issues”
Reviews.Author: TrevorEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 15 to 19 July 2004. Partner & I came over from England on US timeshare package. Allocated this HOTEL - HELL HOLE. Even American's had same opinion. We were on top floor; the balcony rail was crumbling concrete. Looking along the balconies you could see they were all the same, and you could see where concrete had fallen off the roof. Pigeon droppings festooned the balcony rails and floor, and were never cleaned off. During our stay the pool was never cleaned out. Each morning before it was open, you could see the dirt at the bottom of the pool. The size of the twin room was ok, but we had been given a room for the disabled, so had grip rails around the toilet, and bath. Waiting for the lift, was a nightmare, as the air-conditioning motor blew out constant hot air. It is possible to prevent persons from the next balcony coming over and entering your room, HOW!? Well, you can not lock the sliding doors; you have to “put the bar across”. In NO WAY WOULD THIS HOTEL MEET THE HOTEL STANDARDS SET FOR EUROPEEN destinations. After reading this you may think, it can not really be that bad, well it is. If you have booked, do all you can to change. It’s a HELLHOLE!

Reviews.Title: “Dont give up on Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Mirriah
Reviews.Content: I can't write a review on here but don't give up on Daytona Beach! There is a wonderful resort there called the Fairfield Ocean View Resort. It's wonderful, with 7 pools (2 indoors), 4 spas, a computer/reading room, a fast-food restaurant, a bar, and the rooms were just wonderful (with kitchnette). This location is right on the beach. Being a single Mom and with 2 children (almost always in tow) I usually look for a place that we can all unwind and this resort gave it to me! So Please to whom ever wrote the review for this motel and stated that they would never be back to Daytona Beach,, give Daytona a 2nd chance!

HotelInfo.Name: Daytona Seabreeze
HotelInfo.Address: 3125 South Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
